pullRequest.body:
This adds a file `Analysis.SumOverResidueClass`, whose main result is
```lean
/-- A decreasing sequence of real numbers is summable on a residue class
if and only if it is summable. -/
lemma summable_indicator_mod_iff {m : ℕ} [NeZero m] {f : ℕ → ℝ} (hf : Antitone f) (k : ZMod m) :
    Summable ({n : ℕ | (n : ZMod m) = k}.indicator f) ↔ Summable f
```
We then use this to show that the harmonic series still diverges when restricted to a residue class.

This is needed for the proof that the abscissa of absolute convergence of a Dirichlet L-series is 1.

---

bors d+
Thanks!

:v: MichaelStollBayreuth can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

@sgouezel I have now split the lemma `not_summable_indicator_mod_of_antitone_of_neg` into two, with `not_summable_of_antitone_of_neg` extracting the result for the case without restricting to a residue class.
Can you have another look before I hit "merge"?
@sgouezel I'll merge this in the afternoon (CET), unless there is further feedback by then.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8191643630/job/22401311385)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8191643630/job/22401311975)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8191643630/job/22401311109)

**[imports]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```
The suggestion is definitely removing the wrong line. Is this a bug?
Yes, it is unfortunately a known one, but the root cause eludes us still

Do you really need `hf0`? If it is not true, then nothing is ever convergent, so all your lemmas should still be true, right? By the way, could you put the Prop assumptions inside the lemmas instead of as global variables? Otherwise, it makes the file hard to read as the assumptions are not obvious.
I'll move the Prop assumption inside the lemmas. You are right about `hf₀`; I'll work out how to remove it.
Now done.

```suggestion
variable (m : ℕ) [hm : NeZero m]
```
Done.
I'd remove this comment, as I don't see what other target would really make sense (nonnegative reals, maybe, but then it's easy to deduce from the real result).
OK. (I was thinking that maybe there is a more general version possible, but maybe the reals are essentially the only relevant possibility here).

```suggestion
decreasing, then the sum over `f` restricted to any residue class
```
Done.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: sums over residue classes
